channel.title: Big data on mostlymaths.net
channel.description: Recent content in Big data on mostlymaths.net

item.title: 2019#24 Readings of the Week
item.description: Although this week I have been reading mostly Apache Cassandra documentation, I have tried to avoid an onslaught of tips, tricks and readings on it. Just one article.

item.title: 2019#20,21,22 Readings of the week
item.description:
I have been pretty busy lately, and although reading doesn’t stop, my writing sometimes takes a hiatus.

Data engineering, adtech, history, apple. Expect a similar wide range in the future as well. You can check all my weekly readings by checking the [tag here](https://www.mostlymaths.net/search/label/ReadingsOfTheWeek, Readings) . You can also get these as a weekly newsletter by subscribing here.

item.title: 2019#19 Readings of the week
item.description: History, haskell, Wardley mapping, functional programming. Expect a similar wide range in the future as well. You can check all my weekly readings by checking the [tag here](https://www.mostlymaths.net/search/label/ReadingsOfTheWeek, Readings). You can also get these as a weekly newsletter by subscribing here.

item.title: A (section) of a map of the data engineering space
item.description: The map and problem described here were part of my presentation Mapping as a tool for thought, and mentioned in my interview with John Grant and Ben Mosior (to appear sometime soon in the Wardley Maps community youtube channel). I’m looking for ideas on how to make this map easier to understand and useful, so I posted it to the Wardley Maps Community forums requesting comments.

item.title: 2019#17 Readings of the week
item.description:
_This week is a bit light on technical content because I was attending Scala Days 2019 in Lausanne and I had enough with the talks. _

Software engineering, psychology, history. Expect a similar wide range in the future as well. You can check all my weekly readings by checking the [tag here](https://www.mostlymaths.net/search/label/ReadingsOfTheWeek, Readings) . You can also get these as a weekly newsletter by subscribing here.

item.title: Apache Hive and java.lang.ClassCastException on start
item.description: A couple of days ago I installed Hive from Homebrew on my Mac. Sadly, when I tried to run the hive command, I got the weird-looking error
